-> _ = "breakpoint"
(godebug) n
-> x = mul(x, x)
(godebug) list


    func main() {
    	x := mul(1, 2)
    	_ = "breakpoint"
--> 	x = mul(x, x)
    	if x == 4 {
    		fmt.Println("It works! x == 4.")
    	} else if n := 2; n == 3 {
    		fmt.Println("Math is broken. Ah!")

(godebug) step
-> var x int
(godebug) list

    	return n + m
    }

    func mul(n, m int) int {
--> 	var x int
    	for i := 0; i < m; i++ {
    		x = add(x, m)
    	}
    	return x

(godebug) n
-> for i := 0; i < m; i++ {
(godebug) n
-> x = add(x, m)
(godebug) l


    func mul(n, m int) int {
    	var x int
    	for i := 0; i < m; i++ {
--> 		x = add(x, m)
    	}
    	return x
    }

(godebug) continue
What's going on? x == 16
